intro: Hesperozygis kleinii, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its helical stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or violet flowers that open in the morning and close by midday, adapting to the extreme temperatures of its habitat. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, allowing it to conserve water in dry environments. Hesperozygis kleinii is often found growing on rocky slopes and in sandy soils, demonstrating its resilience to harsh desert conditions.
